The Lyndon Township planning commission will use its meeting Monday night to question representatives of McCoig Materials Inc .
This will be the third time that the commission has held public meetings related to the proposed mine , but it is the first chance for commissioners to directly question the mining company .
This will be the third time that the commission has held public meetings related to the proposed mine , but it is the first chance for commissioners to directly question the mining company .
Consulting firm ForEnergy has been representing McCoig throughout the process of obtaining a special use permit for the land from the township 's planning commission .
Local residents have given more than five hours of testimony about the mine , all of it negative and have submitted further information through letters and emails to the commission .

The meeting Monday night comes one week after a public written correspondence between the planning commission and ForEnergy concluded with the consulting firm responding to a large number of questions .

I have been covering this issue for The Ann Arbor News and will be live - blogging tonight 's meeting beginning shortly before 6:00 p.m. If you ca n't make it out the Chelsea tonight , you can read along as I give frequent updates in the comments section of this story as the meeting progresses .
